data.title: Person:Noah Hoggatt (2)
data.text:
Facts and Events

Name Noah Anderson Hoggatt Gender Male Birth , Warren, TN, USA Marriage West Plains, Howell, MO, USAto Sarah Isabelle Davis Death Frisco, Pontotoc, Ok, USA

Noah Anderson Hoggatt FamilyThe Hoggatt name is an old one in American History and dates back to the early 1700's, when two brothers arrived on this continent from England. One brother became a Quaker and his descendants were pioneers who helped to open and develop this country. They were in early Virginia, the Carolinas, Ohio, Illinois, Indiana, Tennessee, Missouri, and Oklahoma. They were doctors, lawyers, ministers, plantation owners, surveyors, farmers and soldiers who gave their lifes blood for this country. Not only fighting Indians while carving out a homestead in the wilderness, but also in each war up to and including the recent Vietnam, conflict.The Noah Anderson Hoggatt family was among the early settlers of Pontotoc County, Indian Territory (Oklahoma), with descendants residing in the Union Valley area for over 40 years.

ID: I006 Name: Noah Anderson HOGGATT Sex: M Birth: 5 MAR 1849 in Warren Co., Tennessee Death: 2 FEB 1915 in Union Valley, Oklahoma Note: Noah Anderson Hoggatt FamilyNoah Anderson Hoggatt was born in Warren County, Tennessee on March 5, 1849, but moved to Peace Valley near West Plains, Howell County, Missouri, at an early age. He was the fourth of seven children born to William Noah and Ruanna (Denton) Hoggatt.His brothers and sisters were William Henry Harrison; James; Isaac B.; John D.; Samuel G.; and, one sister, Mary Ann.On September 11, 1884, Noah A. Hoggatt married Sarah Isabelle Davis, daughter of Thomas Tucker Davis and Melissa (Petty) Davis, at West Plains, Howell County, Missouri. Both Thomas Tucker Davis and Wm. Noah Hoggatt were Baptist ministers.Noah Anderson Hoggatt was a doctor and a farmer. He and Sarah "Sally" removed to near Mountain Home, Arkansas, for a short time before moving on to Indian Territory at Wister where they remained for a few years. In the fall of 1904 they moved to the Union Valley area, by covered wagon, finally settling on what is now known as the old "Hatches" place. Noah Hoggatt was instrumental in building in the first school house in Union Valley, there was a Hoggatt child in attendance until 1945 when the youngest of Noah and Sarah's grandchildren was bussed to Stonewall for the 6th grade.Children of Noah Anderson and Sarah I. (Davis) Hoggatt were:(1) Isaac Thomas, born 10 Dec. 1885, Howell Co., Mo., married Hattie Seeks. He died Feb. 27, 1959 in Memphis, Texas. They were parents of Wallace, Dennis, Veron, Glenn, William Noah (Bill), Damon, Gloria Deli, Joy May and Leon.(2) Nathaniel, born 3 Feb. 1888, married Mary Blackwell, He died 10 June 1961 in Modesto, Calif. They had one son, Thee, born at Frisco, married Bessie Sinclair.(3) Joseph L. born 30 Sept. 1889, married Lela Arnold. After his death Apr. 24, 1958 he was buried at Frisco, Okla. as is two sons, Elbert and J. L. Other children were Lindley who married Bertha and Lois May who married Russel Freerkson. Lela (Amold) Hoggatt resides in Ada.(4) Clarissa A., born 14 Aug. 1891, died 25 July 1931 at Oklahoma City of cancer. She is buried at Stonewall, Okla, She married Gunter Thomas and had two children: Violet and Lloyd.(5) John, born 24 Aug. 1893, died July 15, 1970 at Bloomington, Ind. where his 2nd wife, Pauline resides. He married Ist. Ella Gregg and had two sons, Hershel and John Warren. John Warren Hoggatt resides in Ada, OK.(6) Robert Grady, born Aug. 3, 1898, Wister, I. T., married Jewell Laverne Gray on Oct. 24, 1900, Owl Creek, Okla. Robert was first ordained a minister in the Nazarene Church at Lula, Okla. prior to moving to Yuma, Ariz. in 1953 where he died on May 24, 1966 and is buried at Desert Lawn Memorial Park, Yuma, Ariz. Children of Robert and Jewel are: Volney Leon who married Helen Holmes; Opal Christine; Imogene Fullen; Lola May Walker and, Elba Gynn Johnson.(7) Lillie, born 24 Nov. 1901, Wister, I. T., married first Merle Bullard and had one daughter, Ceneva. Lucille died May 18, 1968 in Portersville, Calif., she was a school teacher.(8) Alice, died as a child and is buried at Frisco, Okla. Her grave is marked by the old tombstone of Noah Anderson Hoggatt.(9) Charles, born 26 Aug, 1908, Union Valley, Pontotoc Co., Okla., married Wilma Darbe. They have no children and reside in Tulsa, Okla.Noah Anderson Hoggatt died Feb. 2, 1915 at Union Valley and is buried at Frisco Cemetery. Sarah I. Hoggatt died Feb. 23, 1929 at Roscoe, Texas and is buried at Frisco Cemetery.Joseph L. (Joe) and Robert G. Hoggatt remained in Union Valley until the mid 1940's when both moved to Ada.Compiled by: Elba Hoggatt Johnson.From: History of Pontotoc County, OklahomaBy:Pontotoc County Historical and Genelogical Society221 West 16thAda, Oklahoma 74820 Father: William Noah HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I077> b: 1818 in Warrem Co., Tennessee Mother: Ruanna DENTON /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I076> b: 1816 in Warren Co., TennesseeMarriage 1 Sarah Isabelle DAVIS /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I005> b: JAN 1866 in Howell Co., Missouri Married: 11 SEP 1884 in West Plains, Missouri Children Isaac Thomas HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I087> b: 10 DEC 1885 in Howell, Missouri Nathaniel HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I086> b: 3 FEB 1888 in Baxter, Arkansas Joseph L. HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I085> b: 30 SEP 1889 in Baxter, Arkansas Clarissa A. HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I019> b: 14 AUG 1891 in Mountain Home, Arkansas John N. HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I083> b: 24 AUG 1893 in Wister, Indian Territory, Oklahoma Robert Grady HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I084> b: 3 AUG 1898 in Wister, Indian Territory, Oklahoma Lillie HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I082> b: 24 NOV 1901 in Wister, Indian Territory, Oklahoma Alice HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I081> b: 1904 in Pontotoc, Indian Territory, Oklahoma Charles HOGGATT /cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=*v18t2340&id=I080> b: 26 AUG 1908 in Union Valley, Indian Territory, Oklahoma
